p: Inflammation is a normal defensive response to tissue injury or infection, functioning to combat invaders to remove damaged or dead host cells [ 30]. Erythrocytes membrane stabilization assay is considered a common tool to screen for anti-inflammatory candidates [ 17]. In this study, Callistemon essential oils showed inhibitory activity to the hemolysis of erythrocytes induced by hypotonic solution. C. viminalis showed potent membrane stabilizing activity exhibiting IC 50 value of 25.6 μg/mL. Results were comparable to Indomethacin (IC 50 17.02 μg/mL). Moreover, C. citrinus showed moderate activity with IC 50 value of 39.9 μg/mL. Meanwhile, C. rigidus displayed weak activity with IC 50 value of 217.1 μg/mL.
